trans-unit.source: Use a RichTextBlock with RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create advanced text layouts.
trans-unit.target: Use a RichTextBlock with RichTextBlockOverflow elements to create advanced text layouts.

trans-unit.source: RichTextBlock
trans-unit.target: RichTextBlock

trans-unit.source: Rich text block
trans-unit.target: Rich text block

trans-unit.source: Rich text blocks provide several features for advanced text layout that you can use when you need support for paragraphs, inline UI elements, or complex text layouts.
trans-unit.target: Rich text blocks provide several features for advanced text layout that you can use when you need support for paragraphs, inline UI elements, or complex text layouts.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: RichTextBlock class
trans-unit.target: RichTextBlock class

trans-unit.source: RichTextBlockOverflow class
trans-unit.target: RichTextBlockOverflow class

trans-unit.source: Paragraph class
trans-unit.target: Paragraph class

trans-unit.source: Typography class
trans-unit.target: Typography class

trans-unit.source: Is this the right control?
trans-unit.target: Is this the right control?

trans-unit.source: Use a **RichTextBlock** when you need support for multiple paragraphs, multi-column or other complex text layouts, or inline UI elements like images.
trans-unit.target: Use a **RichTextBlock** when you need support for multiple paragraphs, multi-column or other complex text layouts, or inline UI elements like images.

trans-unit.source: Use a **TextBlock** to display most read-only text in your app.
trans-unit.target: Use a **TextBlock** to display most read-only text in your app.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to display single-line or multi-line text, inline hyperlinks, and text with formatting like bold, italic, or underlined.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to display single-line or multi-line text, inline hyperlinks, and text with formatting like bold, italic, or underlined.

trans-unit.source: TextBlock provides a simpler content model, so it’s typically easier to use, and it can provide better text rendering performance than RichTextBlock.
trans-unit.target: TextBlock provides a simpler content model, so it’s typically easier to use, and it can provide better text rendering performance than RichTextBlock.

trans-unit.source: It's preferred for most app UI text.
trans-unit.target: It's preferred for most app UI text.

trans-unit.source: Although you can put line breaks in the text, TextBlock is designed to display a single paragraph and doesn’t support text indentation.
trans-unit.target: Although you can put line breaks in the text, TextBlock is designed to display a single paragraph and doesn’t support text indentation.

trans-unit.source: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the [Text controls](text-controls.md) article.
trans-unit.target: For more info about choosing the right text control, see the [Text controls](text-controls.md) article.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: Create a rich text block
trans-unit.target: Create a rich text block

trans-unit.source: The content property of RichTextBlock is the [Blocks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblock.blocks.aspx) property, which supports paragraph based text via the [Paragraph](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.paragraph.aspx) element.
trans-unit.target: The content property of RichTextBlock is the [Blocks](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblock.blocks.aspx) property, which supports paragraph based text via the [Paragraph](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.paragraph.aspx) element.

trans-unit.source: It doesn't have a **Text** property that you can use to easily access the control's text content in your app.
trans-unit.target: It doesn't have a **Text** property that you can use to easily access the control's text content in your app.

trans-unit.source: However, RichTextBlock provides several unique features that TextBlock doesn’t provide.
trans-unit.target: However, RichTextBlock provides several unique features that TextBlock doesn’t provide.

trans-unit.source: RichTextBlock supports:
trans-unit.target: RichTextBlock supports:

trans-unit.source: Multiple paragraphs.
trans-unit.target: Multiple paragraphs.

trans-unit.source: Set the indentation for paragraphs by setting the [TextIndent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblock.textindent.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: Set the indentation for paragraphs by setting the [TextIndent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblock.textindent.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: Inline UI elements.
trans-unit.target: Inline UI elements.

trans-unit.source: Use an [InlineUIContainer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.inlineuicontainer.aspx) to display UI elements, such as images, inline with your text.
trans-unit.target: Use an [InlineUIContainer](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.inlineuicontainer.aspx) to display UI elements, such as images, inline with your text.

trans-unit.source: Overflow containers.
trans-unit.target: Overflow containers.

trans-unit.source: Use [RichTextBlockOverflow](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblockoverflow.aspx) elements to create multi-column text layouts.
trans-unit.target: Use [RichTextBlockOverflow](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblockoverflow.aspx) elements to create multi-column text layouts.

trans-unit.source: Paragraphs
trans-unit.target: Paragraphs

trans-unit.source: You use [**Paragraph**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.paragraph.aspx) elements to define the blocks of text to display within a RichTextBlock control.
trans-unit.target: You use [**Paragraph**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.paragraph.aspx) elements to define the blocks of text to display within a RichTextBlock control.

trans-unit.source: Every RichTextBlock should include at least one Paragraph.
trans-unit.target: Every RichTextBlock should include at least one Paragraph.

trans-unit.source: You can set the indent amount for all paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the [RichTextBlock.TextIndent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblock.textindent.aspx) property.
trans-unit.target: You can set the indent amount for all paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the [RichTextBlock.TextIndent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblock.textindent.aspx) property.

trans-unit.source: You can override this setting for specific paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the [Paragraph.TextIndent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.paragraph.textindent.aspx) property to a different value.
trans-unit.target: You can override this setting for specific paragraphs in a RichTextBlock by setting the [Paragraph.TextIndent](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.paragraph.textindent.aspx) property to a different value.

trans-unit.source: Inline UI elements
trans-unit.target: Inline UI elements

trans-unit.source: The [**InlineUIContainer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.inlineuicontainer.aspx) class lets you embed any UIElement inline with your text.
trans-unit.target: The [**InlineUIContainer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.inlineuicontainer.aspx) class lets you embed any UIElement inline with your text.

trans-unit.source: A common scenario is to place an Image inline with your text, but you can also use interactive elements, like a Button or CheckBox.
trans-unit.target: A common scenario is to place an Image inline with your text, but you can also use interactive elements, like a Button or CheckBox.

trans-unit.source: If you want to embed more than one element inline in the same position, consider using a panel as the single InlineUIContainer child, and then place the multiple elements within that panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to embed more than one element inline in the same position, consider using a panel as the single InlineUIContainer child, and then place the multiple elements within that panel.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to use an InlineUIContainer to insert an image into a RichTextBlock.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to use an InlineUIContainer to insert an image into a RichTextBlock.

trans-unit.source: Overflow containers
trans-unit.target: Overflow containers

trans-unit.source: You can use a RichTextBlock with [**RichTextBlockOverflow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblockoverflow.aspx) elements to create multi-column or other advanced page layouts.
trans-unit.target: You can use a RichTextBlock with [**RichTextBlockOverflow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.controls.richtextblockoverflow.aspx) elements to create multi-column or other advanced page layouts.

trans-unit.source: The content for a RichTextBlockOverflow element always comes from a RichTextBlock element.
trans-unit.target: The content for a RichTextBlockOverflow element always comes from a RichTextBlock element.

trans-unit.source: You link RichTextBlockOverflow elements by setting them as the OverflowContentTarget of a RichTextBlock or another RichTextBlockOverflow.
trans-unit.target: You link RichTextBlockOverflow elements by setting them as the OverflowContentTarget of a RichTextBlock or another RichTextBlockOverflow.

trans-unit.source: Here's a simple example that creates a two column layout.
trans-unit.target: Here's a simple example that creates a two column layout.

trans-unit.source: See the Examples section for a more complex example.
trans-unit.target: See the Examples section for a more complex example.

trans-unit.source: Formatting text
trans-unit.target: Formatting text

trans-unit.source: Although the RichTextBlock stores plain text, you can apply various formatting options to customize how the text is rendered in your app.
trans-unit.target: Although the RichTextBlock stores plain text, you can apply various formatting options to customize how the text is rendered in your app.

trans-unit.source: You can set standard control properties like FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, Foreground, and CharacterSpacing to change the look of the text.
trans-unit.target: You can set standard control properties like FontFamily, FontSize, FontStyle, Foreground, and CharacterSpacing to change the look of the text.

trans-unit.source: You can also use inline text elements and Typography attached properties to format your text.
trans-unit.target: You can also use inline text elements and Typography attached properties to format your text.

trans-unit.source: These options affect only how the RichTextBlock displays the text locally, so if you copy and paste the text into a rich text control, for example, no formatting is applied.
trans-unit.target: These options affect only how the RichTextBlock displays the text locally, so if you copy and paste the text into a rich text control, for example, no formatting is applied.

trans-unit.source: Inline elements
trans-unit.target: Inline elements

trans-unit.source: The [Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.aspx) namespace provides a variety of inline text elements that you can use to format your text, such as Bold, Italic, Run, Span, and LineBreak.
trans-unit.target: The [Windows.UI.Xaml.Documents](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.aspx) namespace provides a variety of inline text elements that you can use to format your text, such as Bold, Italic, Run, Span, and LineBreak.

trans-unit.source: A typical way to apply formatting to sections of text is to place the text in a Run or Span element, and then set properties on that element.
trans-unit.target: A typical way to apply formatting to sections of text is to place the text in a Run or Span element, and then set properties on that element.

trans-unit.source: Here's a Paragraph with the first phrase shown in bold, blue, 16pt text.
trans-unit.target: Here's a Paragraph with the first phrase shown in bold, blue, 16pt text.

trans-unit.source: Typography
trans-unit.target: Typography

trans-unit.source: The attached properties of the [Typography](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.typography.aspx) class provide access to a set of Microsoft OpenType typography properties.
trans-unit.target: The attached properties of the [Typography](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/xaml/windows.ui.xaml.documents.typography.aspx) class provide access to a set of Microsoft OpenType typography properties.

trans-unit.source: You can set these attached properties either on the RichTextBlock, or on individual inline text elements, as shown here.
trans-unit.target: You can set these attached properties either on the RichTextBlock, or on individual inline text elements, as shown here.

trans-unit.source: Recommendations
trans-unit.target: Recommendations

trans-unit.source: See Typography and Guidelines for fonts.
trans-unit.target: See Typography and Guidelines for fonts.

trans-unit.source: This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the [Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=258743).
